description:
Haiti: The new COVID-19 strategy developed by MSPP and UN partners has been adopted by the Multisectoral Commission. It aims at fighting disbelief, denial and refusal behaviours as positive cases
increase. The strategy will use more deeply rooted socio-cultural messages, embodied by credible influencers,
community and religious leaders, as well as coordinate institutional and community-led messaging and reinforce
digital media, radio and TV.
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: PORT-AU-PRINCE (Reuters) - Haitis government on Thursday (March 19) declared a state of emergency over the coronavirus outbreak. On May 20, it was extended until the end of July.

description: On April 20, 2020, Haiti extends the state of emergency first announced on March 19, 2020, for two more months.

description:
Beginning midnight local time on March 16, Haiti is suspending flights from Europe, Canada, the Dominican Republic and Latin America for the next two weeks, Prime Minister Joseph Jouthe announced on Twitter.
Flights from the United States will still be permitted, ""after an agreement with American authorities,"" Jouthe tweeted.
type_sub_cat: NA
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Since the re-opening of its airports on July 1, Haiti is screening the body temperature of all travellers arriving by air. Furthermore, travellers have to complete a health declaration form self declaring their COVID-19 status, as well as location and contact information for their stay in Haiti.
type_sub_cat: NA

description:
Haiti (Presidential Decree May 21, 2020):
Anyone who has been in close contact with a patient, suffering from the pandemic / epidemic virus, must automatically quarantine himself or go for screening within a period not exceeding forty-eight (48) hours or less, as specified by the Ministry of Public Health, and comply with all other measures to combat the pandemic / epidemic provided for by Order adopted by the Council of Ministers.

Original Text:
Toute personne ayant t en contact troit avec un malade, atteint du virus de la pandmie / pidmie, doit se mettre automatiquement en quarantaine ou aller se faire dpister dans un dlai ne dpassant pas quarante-huit (48) heures ou tout laps de temps plus court prvu par le Ministre charg de la Sant Publique, et respecter toutes autres mesures de lutte contre la pandmie / pidmie prvues par Arrte pris en Conseil des Ministres
type_sub_cat: NA

description: On Sunday, April 19, the President of Haiti announced that 5 million face masks would be available in Haiti and that distribution on public markets had already begun.
type_sub_cat: Masks

description: The President announced on 15 May that all shipments of equipment and material for the COVID-19 response worth US$ 18 million that had been ordered by the Government had arrived in Haiti by air. The shipments include PPE (visors, chirurgical masks, N95 masks, and protective goggles), oxygen, oxygen generators, hospital beds andventilators
type_sub_cat: Masks

description: An American (USAID) donation of 37 ventilators has arrived in Haiti on September 3, and will be deployed in hospitals across the country. Furthermore, USAID donated 16.1 Million US$ for training medical staff in Haiti.
type_sub_cat: Masks
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Haiti: As part of the response to COVID-19, the Government announced on 15 April, at a press conference at the CIPC, the publication of a protocol for the care of COVID-19 deceased persons.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for public areas

description:
(Haiti) - Presidential decree: Any driver of a vehicle or transport equipment shall carry out disinfectant cleaning of the vehicle or transport equipment at least once a day.

The vehicle or transport equipment must be ventilated permanently.

The violation of these provisions by the driver is liable to three thousand (3,000.00) Gourdes of fine, five (5) days imprisonment or fifteen (15) days of community service to be determined by the Municipal Council.

Article 3.- Tout conducteur de vhicule ou matriel de transport procde au nettoyage dsinfectant du vhicule ou matriel de transport au moins une fois par jour.

Le vhicule ou matriel de transport est en permanence ar.

La violation de ces dispositions par le conducteur est passible de trois mille (3,000.00) Gourdes d'amende, de cinq (5) jours d'emprisonnement ou de quinze (15) jours de travail d'intrt gnral  dterminer par le Conseil Municipal.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for public areas
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Haitian regulatory authorities announced on Monday, April 6, that intermunicipal public transport between Les Cayes (Arrondissement des Cayes) and Port-au-Prince (Arrondissement des Port-au-Prince) will be suspended at midnight (local time) until further notice due to the ongoing coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic.
type_sub_cat: NA
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Haiti: According to reports on Saturday, April 11, authorities announced the closure to roadway access into the South Department for a period of 15 days, effective from Friday, April 10, through Saturday, April, 25.
type_sub_cat: NA
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On March 19, the President of Haiti announced that people should stay at home and limit their movements to essential movements only.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown applies to all people

description: By presidential decree issued on May 21, 2020, any movement by individuals who tested positive for COVID-19 is prohibited, except to go to the hospital or upon prior authorization.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown applies to all people

description: The Haitian Ministry of National Education and Vocational Training (MENFP), as of April 6, 2020, has set up a Task Force to respond to COVID- 19 in the education sector. This Task Force has been working closely with the UN in coordinating the response. A response plan for the Education sector has been prepared aiming, among other objectives, to enable distance learning for students and their return to school when feasible.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As of April 6, 2020, the government of Haiti has set up a structure for crisis management under the authority of the Prime Minister, which includes three dedicated cells: a scientific cell, a communications cell and a cell for socio-economic response.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Haiti: In addition to the three COVID-19 response coordination cells recently established by the Prime Minister (scientific, communication and socio-economic) the President has created the Multisectoral Commission for the Management of the COVID-19 Pandemic, as of April 14, 2020.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: On March 25, the Prime Minister of Haiti announced that regular food rations will be provided for children who usually benefit from school feeding programmes.
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: Extraordinary provision of goods to mitigate negative social effects by the pandemic.

description: On March 25, the Prime Minister  announced additional extraordinary measures, such as a month's advance salary payment to public officials.
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: Provision of benefits to parts of the workforce to mitigate economic impacts of the pandemic.
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: By presidential decree issued on May 21, 2020, Haiti subjects the intentional/voluntary spreading of the coronavirus to fines of 25,000 gourdes, notwithstanding potential other penalties foreseen by the penal code.
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: Haiti subjects the intentional/voluntary spreading of the coronavirus to fines.

description: Haiti: On 16 March, a Center of Permanent Information on the Coronavirus (CIPC) was launched by the Prime Minister and the Minister of Health. The CIPC is responsible for carrying out awareness-raising actions, health recommendations, through the media, or the coordination of the Ministry of Culture and Communication and under the direction of the Prime Minister's Office. The population will be informed about the prevention, protection and evolution of COVID-19 in the event of a possible appearance and spread of the virus on national soil. Two telephone lines (4343-3333 and 116), have been made available to the public for all information related to the Coronavirus.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: The Haitian Ministry of Health, in cooperation with the UN Population Fund (UNFPA), has launched the information program ""ALo SajFanm"" to inform pregnant women on protection measures for themselves and their babies with regard to the pandemic. Communication via 35 radio stations and printed documents.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Haitian Office of Citizen Protection (OPC), together with the UN, supports sensibilization measures by two Haitian NGOs for police officers and prison guards to prevent infections in prisons and to make them aware of prisoners' rights.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As announced on September 5, the Association of Haitian Journalists, in cooperation with UNICEF and UNESCO, will finance a series of journalistic projects covering different aspects of the pandemic in Haiti, to be completed between October 15 and November 15, 2020. Each project will be funded with 30,000 gourdes.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 19, 2020, the President of Haiti announced a mandatory 14-day quarantine for anyone entering the country.
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine

description:
Haiti (Presidential Decree May 21, 2020):
Anyone who has been in close contact with a patient, suffering from the pandemic / epidemic virus, must automatically quarantine himself or go for screening within a period not exceeding forty-eight (48) hours or less, as specified by the Ministry of Public Health, and comply with all other measures to combat the pandemic / epidemic provided for by Order adopted by the Council of Ministers.

Original Text:
Toute personne ayant t en contact troit avec un malade, atteint du virus de la pandmie / pidmie, doit se mettre automatiquement en quarantaine ou aller se faire dpister dans un dlai ne dpassant pas quarante-huit (48) heures ou tout laps de temps plus court prvu par le Ministre charg de la Sant Publique, et respecter toutes autres mesures de lutte contre la pandmie / pidmie prvues par Arrte pris en Conseil des Ministres
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine

description: Schools, universities, places of worship and industrial parks would be closed
type_sub_cat: Non-Essential Commercial Businesses

description: The municipality of Ptionville (the de facto commercial centre of Port-au-Prince), together with the MSPP, the Haitian National Police (PNH) and the Justice Department, adopted new measures to combat the spread of COVID-19. These measures include a ban on sidewalk sales and a reduction in the opening hours of public markets where now only food vendors are allowed to operate.
type_sub_cat: Non-Essential Commercial Businesses
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice,Municipal Government,Police

description: Haiti: Schools, universities, places of worship and industrial parks have to  be closed from March 19, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Non-Essential Commercial Businesses

description:
Schools, universities, places of worship and industrial parks would be closed. 
Haiti will reopen its key textile industry next week, Prime Minister Joseph Jouthe said on Wednesday (Apr 15), the industry would start running at 30 per cent of its capacity to ensure social distancing in the workplace.
type_sub_cat: Non-Essential Commercial Businesses

description:
Haiti: Schools, universities, places of worship and industrial parks have been closed from March 19, 2020. 
Haiti will reopen its key textile industry next week, Prime Minister Joseph Jouthe said on Wednesday (Apr 15), the industry would start running at 30 per cent of its capacity to ensure social distancing in the workplace.
type_sub_cat: Non-Essential Commercial Businesses

description: On 25 March, the Prime Minister of Haiti announced additional response and mitigation measures (following the 19 March declaration of Health Emergency) for the public and private sectors, as well as for the population. Public and private institutions will continue to operate on a 50 per cent staff rotation basis implementing all mandated hygiene measures and instructions.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine

description: Haiti: As of March 31, 2020, the Minister of Justice and Public Security (MJSP) and the Superior Council of the Judicial Power (CSPJ) foresee measures to postpone procedures and legal deadlines in the judicial system. Eligible detainees are planned to be released (visits for the rest will be prohibited) and prolonged preventive detention will be avoided.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Other Quarantine
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Justice,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On May 21 as infections rose, Haitian president Mose announced sweeping new measures to prevent the spread of the virus. These prohibited any public gathering of more than five people, adding that those in violation would be fined 3,000 Haitian Gourdes (about $27) or possibly face a five-day prison sentence or a 15 days of community service.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: In a press statement published on 30 April, the Prime Minister of Haiti announced the mandatory wearing of face masks in all public spaces as of 11 May. This measure particularly applies to employees in their workplace, drivers, passengers of public transportation, people circulating in any public space, as well as in hospitals, shops, banks and any other private or public institutions.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
